abstract: The move is squarely aimed at helping Airbus and its parent company, European Aeronautics Defense and Space, maintain production during the current credit crunch.
snippet: The move is squarely aimed at helping Airbus and its parent company, European Aeronautics Defense and Space, maintain production during the current credit crunch.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  France will guarantee up to 5 billion euros in loans to help airlines finance the purchase of aircraft, a move squarely aimed at helping Airbus and its parent company, European Aeronautics Defense and Space, maintain production during the current credit crunch, officials said Monday.

headline.main: France Looks to Help Airbus With Loan Guarantees
headline.print_headline: France Looks to Help Airbus With Loan Guarantees
